artist: Engraver: Adriaen Collaert; Artist: after Joannes Stradanus (Jan van der Straet); Publisher: Philips Galle
catalogue_raissonne:
New Hollstein (Dutch and Flemish) 1182 ( The Collaert Dynasty)
New Hollstein ( Dutch and Flemish) 312 ( Johannes Stradanus)
Baroni Vannucci 1997 709.4
description: Calligula on horseback wearing winged helmet of Mercury, holding the trident of Poisedon in PR hand and thunderbolts of Zeus in PL hand; in distance troops, harbor and ships; pedestal decorated with scene of his murder on one side and a naked male figure lying on a pile of coins on the other side.
inscription:
Signature, Title, and Inscription

in image in black on pedestal: Adrian Collaert Sculp.   Ioann. Stradamus invent.   Pbl\'s Galle excud | below image in black: 4.  CALIGULA  /  followed by 2 columns of three lines in Latin: Nec Deus es .../ .../ ... Roma voluto est  | on sheet in pencil: 2-439
title: Caligula
